# <img src="https://i.imgur.com/39pvr4n.png" align="right" height=44 /> fgeo.template

[![lifecycle](https://img.shields.io/badge/lifecycle-experimental-orange.svg)](https://www.tidyverse.org/lifecycle/#experimental)
[![CRAN status](https://www.r-pkg.org/badges/version/fgeo.template)](https://cran.r-project.org/package=fgeo.template)
[![Travis build status](https://travis-ci.org/forestgeo/fgeo.template.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/forestgeo/fgeo.template)

__fgeo.template__ provides templates to build __fgeo__ packages.

## Installation

```
# install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("forestgeo/fgeo.template")
```

For details on how to install packages from GitHub, see [this article](https://goo.gl/dQKEeg).

## Example

This is a basic example which shows you how to solve a common problem:

```{r
library(usethis)
use_template(template = "README.Rmd", package = "fgeo.template")
```
